column4: is it possible to set up a cron job that logs into a website as if a user was browsing it
a site that requires a login/pass through a cgi form
of course, but you will have to know some web programming
i'm not sure how complicated what you want to do is, but it is probably a job for perl or python
i hope you know sed :-)
you can't just do it with grep, you need sed/perl/python (awk?)
why do you want to remove atd?
if something else depends on it (i doubt anything does) you could break things by removing it
but most people don't use it so you're probably safe
so you would have atd do something in the future in case what you were going to work on broke something
for example, if i was going to change iptables, i would have an at job to restore the old settings in ten minutes, so if the new settings break something i can still get back to the box
if everything goes smoothly you just remove the job from the queue
yeah, they're actually mostly sharing memory so they don't use as much ram as you would think
it uses both, i'm not really sure under which scenarios though
this is the syslog entry... http://rafb.net/p/xXI42U34.html
also, if that is the case, then it is a bug in dhclient
ok, then run it is aroot?
um, are you trying to use dhcp or not?
my isp assigns the ip address, cable modem straight to the box
just use the dhcp lease the cable modem gives out, it will be correct
so no need for dhcpclient running?
